member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeBinding.DataMember
member.summary: Gets or sets the data member to bind to a menu item.

remarks.para: When creating a RadMenuItemBinding object, you must specify the criteria for binding. The criteria indicate when a data item should be bound to a menu item. You can specify the Depth property, the DataMember property, or both.

When the data source contains multiple elements or tables, use the DataMember property to specify the element or table to bind to a menu item. A data member specifies the type of the data item in the underlying data source, but can represent different information depending on the data source. Each data item in a hierarchical data source exposes a IHierarchyData.Type property, which specifies the type of the data item. For example, the data member for an XML element specifies the name of the element. The following RadMenuItemBinding declaration binds the
<Book> elements of an XmlDataSource control to all the menu items in the menu, regardless of the location in the hierarchy:

Sometimes you might need to create a menu item binding that specifies both a depth and a data member. This is often used when the data source contains items at different levels that have the same data member value. For example, you can have
<Item> elements that appear at different levels within an XML file. The following RadMenuItemBinding declarations show how to specify menu item bindings that apply to identical data members at different menu depths:

If a menu item binding is defined without a depth or a data member, the menu item binding is applied to all menu items within the menu. This is commonly used when all data items have the same properties and should be displayed identically, regardless of the menu depth.

After the binding criteria are established, you can then bind a property of a RadMenuItem object that can be bound to a value. You can bind to a field of a data item or to a static value. When bound to a static value, all RadMenuItem objects to which the RadMenuItemBinding object is applied share the same value. Properties bound to fields contain the values of the field from the data source.
If conflicting RadMenuItemBinding objects are defined, the Menu control applies the menu item bindings in the following order of precedence:

item.para: The RadMenuItemBinding object that defines and matches both a depth and a data member.
The RadMenuItemBinding object that defines and matches the data member only.
The RadMenuItemBinding object that defines and matches the depth only.
The RadMenuItemBinding object that defines neither the depth nor the data member. (This type of menu item binding is applied to all menu items in the menu.)

The RadMenuItemBinding object that does not have a match in the data source. In this case, the value returned by the ToString() method of the data item is then bound to the Text and Value properties of the menu items to which the RadMenuItemBinding object is applied.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeBinding.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text caption for the item.
member.value: The text of the item. The default value is empty string.
member.example:
This example demonstrates how to set the text of the item using the Text property.
<radM:RadMenu ID="RadMenu1" runat="server">
<Items>
<radM:RadMenuItem Text="News" />
<radM:RadMenuItem Text="News" />
</Items>
</radM:RadMenu>
member.remarks: Specifying Text or TextField will override the values populated from the DataTextField property.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeBinding.TextField
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the field from the data source to bind to the Text property of a RadMenuItem object to which the RadMenuItemBinding object is applied.
member.value: The name of the field from the data source to bind to the Text of a RadMenuItem to which the RadMenuItemBinding is applied. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.
member.remarks: Specifying Text or TextField will override the values populated from the DataTextField property.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeBinding.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value associated with the item.
member.value: The value associated with the item. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the Value property to specify or determine the value associated with the item.
Specifying Value or ValueField will override the values populated from the DataValueField property.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeBinding.ValueField
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the field from the data source to bind to the Value property of a RadMenuItem object to which the RadMenuItemBinding object is applied.
member.value: The name of the field from the data source to bind to the Value of a RadMenuItem to which the RadMenuItemBinding is applied. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

remarks.para: Specifying Value or ValueField will override the values populated from the DataValueField property.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeBinding.NavigateUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL to link to when the item is clicked.
member.value: The URL to link to when the item is clicked. The default value is empty string.
member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to use the NavigateUrl property
<radM:RadMenu id="RadMenu1" runat="server">
<Items>
<radM:RadMenuItem Text="News" NavigateUrl="~/News.aspx" />
<radM:RadMenuItem Text="External URL" NavigateUrl="http://www.example.com" />
</Items>
</radM:RadMenu>

remarks.para: Use the NavigateUrl property to specify the URL to link to when the item is clicked. Use "~" (tilde) in front of an URL within the same ASP.NET application. When specifying external URL do not forget the protocol (e.g. "http://").
Specifying NavigateUrl or NavigateUrlField will override the values populated from the DataNavigateUrlField property.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeBinding.NavigateUrlField
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the field from the data source to bind to the NavigateUrl property of a RadMenuItem object to which the RadMenuItemBinding object is applied.
member.value: The name of the field from the data source to bind to the NavigateUrl of a RadMenuItem to which the RadMenuItemBinding is applied. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

remarks.para: Specifying %NavigateUrl:NavigateUrl% or NavigateUrlField will override the values populated from the DataNavigateUrlField property.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeBinding.ToolTip
member.summary: Gets or sets the ToolTip text for a menu item to which the RadMenuItemBinding object is applied.
member.value: The ToolTip text for a menu item to which the RadMenuItemBinding is applied. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeBinding.ToolTipField
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the field from the data source to bind to the ToolTip property of a RadMenuItem object to which the RadMenuItemBinding object is applied.
member.value: The name of the field from the data source to bind to the ToolTip of a RadMenuItem to which the RadMenuItemBinding is applied. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeBinding.ImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL to an image that is displayed next to the text of a menu item to which the RadMenuItemBinding object is applied.
member.value: The URL to an image that is displayed next to the text of a menu item to which the RadMenuItemBinding is applied. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

remarks.para: This image is shared with all RadMenuItem objects to which the RadMenuItemBinding object is applied.
NOTE: You can override the image for an individual menu item by setting its ImageUrl property directly.

Instead of using this property to display the same image in each menu item, you can also use the ImageUrlField property to bind the ImageUrl property of a RadMenuItem object to a field of a data source. When rendered, the ImageUrl property of each menu item to which the RadMenuItemBinding object is applied contains the corresponding value from the field.
NOTE: If the ImageUrl and ImageUrlField properties are both set, the ImageUrlField property takes precedence.

notes.para: You can override the image for an individual menu item by setting its ImageUrl property directly.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeBinding.ImageUrlField
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the field from the data source to bind to the ImageUrl property of a RadMenuItem object to which the RadMenuItemBinding object is applied.
member.value: The name of the field from the data source to bind to the ImageUrl of a RadMenuItem to which the RadMenuItemBinding is applied. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

remarks.para: If the data source contains multiple tables or attributes, you must first establish the binding criteria by setting the Depth property, the DataMember property, or both.

Instead of using this property to bind the ImageUrl property of a RadMenuItem object to a field, you can also bind it to a static value by setting the RadMenuItemBinding.ImageUrl property. This allows you to display the same image in each menu item to which the RadMenuItemBinding object is applied.
If the ImageUrl and ImageUrlField properties are both set, the ImageUrlField property takes precedence.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeBinding.ImageExpandedUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to an image to display for the item when the user moves the mouse over the item.
member.value: The path to the image to display when the user moves the mouse over the item. The default value is empty string.

example.para:
<radm:RadMenu id="RadMenu1" runat="server">
<Items>
<radm:RadMenuItem ImageUrl="~/Img/inbox.gif" ImageExpandedUrl="~/Img/inboxOver.gif" Text="Index" />
<radm:RadMenuItem ImageUrl="~/Img/outbox.gif" ImageExpandedUrl="~/Img/outboxOver.gif" Text="Outbox" />
</Items>
</radm:RadMenu>

member.remarks: Use the ImageExpandedUrl property to specify the image that will be used when the user moves the mouse over the item. If the ImageExpandedUrl property is set to empty string the image specified by the ImageUrl property will be used. Use "~" (tilde) when referring to images within the current ASP.NET application.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeBinding.ImageExpandedUrlField
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the field from the data source to bind to the ImageExpandedUrl property of a RadMenuItem object to which the RadMenuItemBinding object is applied.
member.value: The name of the field from the data source to bind to the ImageExpandedUrl of a RadMenuItem to which the RadMenuItemBinding is applied. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeBinding.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets the target window or frame to display the Web page content linked to when the menu item is clicked.
member.value:
The target window or frame to load the Web page linked to when the Item is selected. Values must begin with a letter in the range of a through z (case insensitive), except for the following special values, which begin with an underscore:
_blank Renders the content in a new window without frames.
_parent Renders the content in the immediate frameset parent.
_self Renders the content in the frame with focus.
_top Renders the content in the full window without frames.
The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the Target property to specify the frame or window that displays the Web page linked to when the menu item is clicked. The Web page is specified by setting the NavigateUrl property.
If this property is not set, the Web page specified by the NavigateUrl property is loaded in the current window.

example.para: The following example demonstrates how to use the Target property

member.value: The name of the field from the data source to bind to the Target of a RadMenuItem to which the RadMenuItemBinding is applied. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeBinding.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the menu item is enabled.

remarks.para: Use the Enabled property to specify or determine whether a menu item is functional. When set to false, the item appears dimmed.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeBinding.EnabledField
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the field from the data source to bind to the Enabled property of a RadMenuItem object to which the RadMenuItemBinding object is applied.
member.value: The name of the field from the data source to bind to the Enabled of a RadMenuItem to which the RadMenuItemBinding is applied. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.

summary.para: Gets or sets the menu depth to which the RadMenuItemBinding object is applied.

remarks.para: When creating a RadMenuItemBinding object, you must specify the criteria for binding. The criteria indicate when a data item should be bound to a menu item. You can specify the Depth property, the DataMember property, or both.

Use the Depth property to specify the menu depth at which to apply the RadMenuItemBinding object. For example, the following RadMenuItemBinding declaration binds the Name and ID fields of the data source to the Text and Value properties, respectively, of all menu items with a depth of 0:

Sometimes you might need to create a menu item binding that specifies both a depth and a data member. This is often used when the data source contains items at different levels that have the same data member value. For example, you can have
<Item> elements that appear at different levels within an XML file. The following RadMenuItemBinding declarations show how to specify menu item bindings that apply to identical data members at different menu depths:

If a menu item binding is defined without a depth and a data member, the menu item binding is applied to all menu items within the menu. This is commonly used when all data items have the same properties and should be displayed identically, regardless of the menu depth.

After the binding criteria are established, you can then bind a property of a RadMenuItem object that can be bound to a value. You can bind to a field of a data item or to a static value. When bound to a static value, all RadMenuItem objects to which the RadMenuItemBinding object is applied share the same value. Properties bound to fields contain the values of the field from the data source.
If conflicting RadMenuItemBinding objects are defined, the Menu control applies the menu item bindings in the following order of precedence:

item.para: The RadMenuItemBinding object that defines and matches both a depth and a data member.
The RadMenuItemBinding object that defines and matches the data member only.
The RadMenuItemBinding object that defines and matches the depth only.
The RadMenuItemBinding object that defines neither the depth nor the data member. (This type of menu item binding is applied to all menu items in the menu.)

The RadMenuItemBinding object that does not have a match in the data source. In this case, the value returned by the ToString() method of the data item is then bound to the Text and Value properties of the menu items to which the RadMenuItemBinding object is applied.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.GetAllNodes
member.summary: Gets a linear ArrayList of ALL nodes in the current treeview instance.

summary.para: Gets a collection of RadTreeNode objects that represents the root nodes in the RadTreeView control.

remarks.para: Use the Nodes property to get a RadTreeNodeCollection object that contains all the root nodes in the tree. This collection is commonly used to quickly iterate through all the root nodes, or to access a specific root node in the tree.

Note:
A typical tree structure has only one root node; however, you can add multiple root nodes to the TreeView control.

The Nodes property can also be used to manage the root nodes in the tree programmatically. You can add, insert, remove, and retrieve RadTreeNode objects from the collection. Any updates to the collection are automatically reflected in the RadTreeView control after the next round trip to the server.
To access the child nodes of a root node, use the Nodes property of the node. Use the ChildNodes property of each subsequent parent-level node to navigate down the node levels.

member.name: E:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.NodeClick
member.summary: eThe event that fires upon node click.

member.name: E:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.NodeCheck
member.summary: The event that fires when a node text has been checked.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.CheckedNodes
member.summary: Gets a collection of RadTreeNode objects that represent the nodes in the control that display a selected check box.
member.returns: An ArrayList collection of the checked nodes.

remarks.para: When check boxes are displayed in the RadTreeView control (by setting the CheckBoxes property to true), use the CheckedNodes property to determine which nodes display a selected check box. This collection is commonly used to iterate through all the nodes that have a selected check box in the tree.

If the AutoPostBackOnCheck property of the tree is set to true, the NodeCheck event is raised when the check boxes of the RadTreeView control change state between posts to the server. This allows you to provide an event-handling method that performs a custom routine, such as updating a database or the displayed content, whenever this event occurs.

Note:
The CheckedNodes collection is populated using a depth-first traversal of the tree structure: each parent node is processed down to its child nodes before the next parent node is populated.

example.code: Protected Sub ShowCheckedNodes(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Dim message As String = String.Empty Dim nodeCollection As ArrayList = RadTree1.CheckedNodes Dim node As RadTreeNode For Each node In nodeCollection message += node.FullPath Next node nodes.Text = message End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.SelectedNodes
member.summary: Gets a collection of RadTreeNode objects that represent the nodes in the control that are currently selected.
member.returns: An ArrayList collection of the selected nodes.

remarks.para: This collection is commonly used to iterate through all the nodes that have been selected in the tree.

If the AutoPostBack property is set to true, the NodeClick event is raised when end-users select a node in the RadTreeView control. This allows you to provide an event-handling method that performs a custom routine, such as updating a database or the displayed content, whenever this event occurs.

Note:
The SelectedNodes collection is populated using a depth-first traversal of the tree structure: each parent node is processed down to its child nodes before the next parent node is populated.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.SelectedNode
member.summary: Gets a RadTreeNode object that represents the selected node in the RadTreeView control.

remarks.para: The text of a node in the RadTreeView control can be in one of three modes: default (none), selection (postback) mode and navigation mode. To put a node into navigation mode, set the Href property for the node to a value other than an empty string (""). To put a node into selection mode, set the AutoPostBack of the treeview to true (sets postback mode for all tree nodes) or set the PostBack property of any node to true.
When a node is in selection mode, the user can select a node by clicking on the text in the node. Use the SelectedNode property to determine which node is selected in the TreeView control.

Note:
A node cannot be selected when the TreeView control displays hyperlinks. When hyperlinks are displayed, the SelectedNode property always returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

When the user selects a different node in the RadTreeView control by clicking the text in the new node, the NodeClick event is raised, by default. If you set the MultipleSelect property of the treeview to true, end-users can select multiple nodes by holding the Ctrl / Shift keys while selecting.

example.code:
<radT:RadTreeView ID="RadTree1" runat="server" AutoPostBack="True" OnNodeClick="NodeClick" />
Protected Sub NodeClick(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal NodeEventArgs As RadTreeNodeEventArgs) info.Text = String.Empty Dim NodeClicked As RadTreeNode = NodeEventArgs.NodeClicked info.Text = NodeClicked.Text End Sub

<radT:RadTreeView
                ID="RadTree1"
                runat="server"
                AutoPostBack="True"
                OnNodeClick="NodeClick"
            />
             
            protected void NodeClick(object sender, RadTreeNodeEventArgs NodeEventArgs)
            {
                info.Text = string.Empty;
                RadTreeNode NodeClicked = NodeEventArgs.NodeClicked;
                info.Text = NodeClicked.Text;
            }

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.IsEmpty
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the RadTreeView control has no nodes.

summary.para: Gets or sets the object from which the data-bound control retrieves its list of data items.

remarks.para: DataTextField (optional) - Gets or sets the field name from a data source to bind to the RadTreeNode Text property.

DataValueField (optional) - Gets or sets the field name from a data source to bind to the RadTreeNode Value property.
DataBind() - (mandatory) menthod. Call this method after you've set the aforementioned properties per your scenario.

example.code:
Dim dbCon As New OleDbConnection("Provider=Microsoft.Jet.OLEDB.4.0;Data Source=" + Server.MapPath("~/TreeView/Data/Tree.mdb")) dbCon.Open()
Dim adapter As New OleDbDataAdapter("SELECT * FROM Links", dbCon) Dim ds As New DataSet() adapter.Fill(ds)
RadTree1.DataTextField = "TextColumn" RadTree1.DataValueField = "ValueColumn" RadTree1.DataFieldID = "ID" RadTree1.DataFieldParentID = "ParentID"
RadTree1.DataSource = ds RadTree1.DataBind()

remarks.para: DataTextField (optional) - Gets or sets the field name from a data source to bind to the RadTreeNode Text property.

DataValueField (optional) - Gets or sets the field name from a data source to bind to the RadTreeNode Value property.
DataBind() - (mandatory) menthod. Call this method after you've set the aforementioned properties per your scenario.

summary.para: Gets or sets the specific data member in a multimember data source to bind to a data listing control.

example.code:

Dim adapter As New OleDbDataAdapter("SELECT * FROM Links", dbCon) Dim ds As New DataSet() adapter.Fill(ds)
RadTree1.DataTextField = "TextColumn" RadTree1.DataValueField = "ValueColumn" RadTree1.DataFieldID = "ID" RadTree1.DataFieldParentID = "ParentID"
RadTree1.DataSource = ds RadTree1.DataBind()

summary.para: Gets or sets the field name from a data source to determine the parent ID of the nodes to bind.

remarks.para: DataTextField (optional) - Gets or sets the field name from a data source to bind to the RadTreeNode Text property.

DataValueField (optional) - Gets or sets the field name from a data source to bind to the RadTreeNode Value property.
DataBind() - (mandatory) menthod. Call this method after you've set the aforementioned properties per your scenario.

example.code:
Dim dbCon As New OleDbConnection("Provider=Microsoft.Jet.OLEDB.4.0;Data Source=" + Server.MapPath("~/TreeView/Data/Tree.mdb")) dbCon.Open()
Dim adapter As New OleDbDataAdapter("SELECT * FROM Links", dbCon) Dim ds As New DataSet() adapter.Fill(ds)
RadTree1.DataTextField = "TextColumn" RadTree1.DataValueField = "ValueColumn" RadTree1.DataFieldID = "ID" RadTree1.DataFieldParentID = "ParentID"
RadTree1.DataSource = ds RadTree1.DataBind()

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.LoadingMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets the loading message that is displayed when child nodes are retrieved on AJAX calls.
member.remarks: This property can be used for localization purposes (e.g. "Loading..." in different languages).

example.code: Protected Sub LoadingMessagePositionChanged(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Select Case LoadingMessagePos.SelectedItem.Value Case "Before" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.BeforeNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessageCssClass = "LoadingMessageBlue" RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ..)" Case "After" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.AfterNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessageCssClass = "LoadingMessageBlue" RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ...)" Case "Below" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.BelowNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessageCssClass = "LoadingMessage" RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ...)" Case "None" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.None End Select End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.LoadingMessageCssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the Css class name that is applied to the loading message when child nodes are retrieved on AJAX calls.

example.code: Protected Sub LoadingMessagePositionChanged(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Select Case LoadingMessagePos.SelectedItem.Value Case "Before" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.BeforeNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessageCssClass = "LoadingMessageBlue" RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ..)" Case "After" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.AfterNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessageCssClass = "LoadingMessageBlue" RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ...)" Case "Below" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.BelowNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessageCssClass = "LoadingMessage" RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ...)" Case "None" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.None End Select End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.LoadingMessagePosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the loading message when child nodes are retrieved on AJAX calls.

example.code: Protected Sub LoadingMessagePositionChanged(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Select Case LoadingMessagePos.SelectedItem.Value Case "Before" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.BeforeNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessageCssClass = "LoadingMessageBlue" RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ..)" Case "After" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.AfterNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessageCssClass = "LoadingMessageBlue" RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ...)" Case "Below" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.BelowNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessageCssClass = "LoadingMessage" RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ...)" Case "None" RadTree1.LoadingMessagePosition = LoadingMessagePosition.None End Select End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.Sort
member.summary: Gets or sets the sort order of the tree nodes in RadTreeView.

remarks.para:
RadTreeView supports node sorting. The only thing you need to do is to set the Sort property of RadTreeView to one of the following values:
- Ascending
- Descending
- None
Please, take into account that the treeview sorts the nodes just prior to content rendering on screen, not upon node adding / removing from the collection.

example.code: Protected Sub SortOrderChanged(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Select Case SortOrder.SelectedItem.Value Case "Ascending" RadTree1.Sort = RadTreeViewSort.Ascending Case "Descending" RadTree1.Sort = RadTreeViewSort.Descending Case Else RadTree1.Sort = RadTreeViewSort.None End Select End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.AllowNodeEditing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the text of the tree nodes are editable in the browser.

remarks.para: End-users can edit the text of tree-nodes by pressing F2 when the node is selected or by clicking on a node that is already selected (slow double click).
You can disable / enable node editing for specific tree nodes by setting the EditEnabled property of the specific RadTreeNode.

After node editing, RadTreeView fires the NodeEdit event and you can change the text of the node - the RadTreeNode instance is contained in the NodeEdited property of the event arguments and the new text is in the NewText property of the event arguments.

example.code:
<radT:RadTreeView ID="RadTree1" Runat="server" AllowNodeEditing="True" OnNodeEdit="HandleNodeEdit" />
Protected Sub HandleNodeEdit(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal NodeEvents As RadTreeNodeEventArgs) Dim nodeEdited As RadTreeNode = NodeEvents.NodeEdited Dim newText As String = NodeEvents.NewText
nodeEdited.Text = newText End Sub

<radT:RadTreeView
                ID="RadTree1"
                Runat="server"
                AllowNodeEditing="True"
                OnNodeEdit="HandleNodeEdit"
            />
             
            protected void HandleNodeEdit(object sender, RadTreeNodeEventArgs NodeEvents)
            {            
                RadTreeNode nodeEdited = NodeEvents.NodeEdited;
                string newText = NodeEvents.NewText;
             
                nodeEdited.Text = newText;
            }

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.ExpandDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the value controlling the duration of the expand animation effect on collapse / expand.
member.remarks: The default value is 2. Set the property to 0 to disable the animation effect on expand / collapse.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.ShowLineImages
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the dotted lines indenting the nodes should be displayed or not.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.SingleExpandPath
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether only the current branch of the treeview is expanded.
member.remarks: The property closes all nodes that are not parents of the last expanded node. This property is only effective on the client browser - in postback modes you need to handle the logic yourself.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.ContentFile
member.summary: The full location (path + filename) of the XML content file used to populate the menu.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.AjaxUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the base URL which the AJAX calls will be made to.
member.value: the base URL which the AJAX calls will be made to.

remarks.para: The AjaxUrl might need to be different on different usage scenarios. For example it is good to set it to Request.CurrentExecutionFilePath when using a Server.Transfer().

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.ContextMenuContentFile
member.summary: The full location (path + filename) of the XML content file used to populate the menu.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.ImagesBaseDir
member.summary: The directory where image files used in the treeview reside (path relative to application root)

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.AutoPostBack
member.summary: When set to true all treenodes automatically generate server-event (postback).

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.AutoPostBackOnCheck
member.summary: When set to true all the checkboxes generate server-event (postback) upon click.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.CheckBoxes
member.summary: When set to true displays a checkbox next to each treenode.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.MultipleSelect
member.summary: When set to true the treeview allows multiple node selection (by holding down ctrl key while selecting nodes)

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.DragAndDrop

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.DragAndDropBetweenNodes
member.summary: When set to true enables drag-and-drop visual clue (underline) between nodes while draggin

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.CausesValidation

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.AfterClientFocus

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.AfterClientHighlight

member.summary: The name of the Javascript function that will be called when the user toggles (expand/collapse) a treenode. Receives a single parameter - the instance of the toggled node.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.AfterClientMove

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.SkinsPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the relative path of the folder containing the skins.
member.example: If the skin folder is located in the project root and is named "Skins" the SkinsPath property should be set to: "~/Skins". Then you can create subfolders for individual skins e.g. Skins/Gold, Skins/Classic etc.
member.value: A string specifying the relative path to the folder which contains r.a.d.treeview skins. The default value is "~/RadControls/TreeView/Skins".
member.remarks: r.a.d.input ships with a set of predefined skins which are ready to use. They are located in RadControls/TreeView/Skins.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.RetainScrollPosition
member.summary: Instructs the treeview to auto-scroll to the selected node after postback

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.ValidationGroup

para.font: Note: This property is new in the .NET Framework version 2.0.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the validation group to which this validation control belongs.

member.value: The name of the validation group to which this validation control belongs. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.
member.remarks: This property works only when CausesValidation is set to true.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.PostBackUrl

summary.para: Gets or sets the URL of the page to post to from the current page when a tab from the tabstrip is clicked.

member.value: The URL of the Web page to post to from the current page when a tab from the tabstrip control is clicked. The default value is an empty string (""), which causes the page to post back to itself.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeView.IsCallBack
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the page request is the result of a TreeView callback.

example.code: If Not Page.IsPostBack AndAlso RadTreeView1.IsCallBack 'your init code here End If

member.remarks: IsCallBack can be used to skip heavy initialization code. On TreeView callback, Page.IsPostBack is false and code inside If Not Page.IsPostBack block gets executed too. You can skip that by adding the RadTreeView.IsCallBack check.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandMode
member.summary: This enumeration controls the expand behaviour of the nodes.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandMode.ClientSide
member.summary: The default behaviour - all nodes are loaded in the intial request and expand is performed on the client, without server interaction

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandMode.ServerSide
member.summary: Forces firing of the NodeExpand event - a postback occurs and developers can populate the node with its children in server side event handler

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.ExpandMode.ServerSideCallBack
member.summary: Forces firing of the NodeExpand event asyncronously from the client without postback - the NodeExpand event fires and child nodes added to the node collection are automatically transferred to the client without postback.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.LoadingMessagePosition
member.summary: Specifies where the loading message is shown when Client-side load on demand is used.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.LoadingMessagePosition.BeforeNodeText
member.summary: If the node text is "Some Text", the text is changed to "(loading ...) Some Text" when child nodes are being loaded (Assuming the LoadingMessage property has been set to "(loading...)";

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.LoadingMessagePosition.AfterNodeText
member.summary: If the node text is "Some Text", the text is changed to "Some Text (loading ...)" when child nodes are being loaded (Assuming the LoadingMessage property has been set to "(loading...)";

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.LoadingMessagePosition.BelowNodeText
member.summary: The text is not changed and (loading ...)" when child nodes are being loaded (Assuming the LoadingMessage property has been set to "(loading...)";

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.LoadingMessagePosition.None
member.summary: No loading text is displayed at all.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeViewSort
member.summary: The Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeViewSort enumeration supports three values - None, Ascending, Descending. Default is None.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeViewSort.None
member.summary: Nodes are not sorted at all.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeViewSort.Ascending
member.summary: Nodes are sorted in ascending order (min to max)

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeViewSort.Descending
member.summary: Nodes are sorted in descending order (max to min)

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode
member.summary: Represents a single item in the RadTreeView class.

remarks.para: The RadTreeView control is made up of a hierarchy of menu items represented by RadTreeNode objects. Menu items at the top level (level 0) that do not have a parent menu item are called root or top-level menu items. A menu item that has a parent menu item is called a submenu item. All root menu items are stored in the Items collection of the menu. Submenu items are stored in a parent menu item's Items collection. You can access a menu item's parent menu item by using the Owner property.
To create the menu items for a RadTreeView control, use one of the following methods:

list.item: Use declarative syntax to create static menu items.
Use a constructor to dynamically create new instances of the RadTreeNode class. These RadTreeNode objects can then be added to the Items collection of their owner.
Bind the Menu control to a data source.

remarks.para: When the user clicks a menu item, the Menu control can either navigate to a linked Web page or simply post back to the server. If the NavigateUrl property of a menu item is set, the RadTreeView control navigates to the linked page. By default, a linked page is displayed in the same window or frame as the RadTreeView control. To display the linked content in a different window or frame, use the Target property.

Each menu item has a Text and a Value property. The value of the Text property is displayed in the RadTreeView control, while the Value property is used to store any additional data about the menu item.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Toggle
member.summary: Toggles Expand/Collapse state of the node.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.ExpandChildNodes
member.summary: Expands all child nodes of the node.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.ExpandParentNodes
member.summary: Expands all parent nodes of the node.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.CollapseChildNodes
member.summary: Collapses recursively all child nodes of the node.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.CollapseParentNodes
member.summary: Expands all parent nodes of the node.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.GetFullPath(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the full path (location) of the node delimited by the specified character.
member.param: The character to use as a delimiter
member.returns: Returns the full path of the node delimited by the specified character.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Parent
member.summary: The parent RadTreeNode. Null if there's no parent (root node).

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.CssClass
member.summary: Custom CSS class applied only on the current node. Overrides NodeCssClass from the parent RadTreeView.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.CssClassOver
member.summary: Custom CSS class applied only on the current node when the mouse hovers the node. Overrides NodeCssClassOver from the parent RadTreeView.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.CssClassSelect
member.summary: Custom CSS class applied only on the current node. Overrides NodeCssClassSelect from the parent RadTreeView.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Text
member.summary: The text the the node displays on screen.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Value
member.summary: Can be used to store information that is available both on client and server side.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Category
member.summary: Can be used to distinguish between different categories of nodes. For example some nodes may belong to category "Country", others to "Continent", etc. Using the property makes it easier to find which category the current node belongs to on both client and server side.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.ToolTip
member.summary: Displays a hint popup information when the user points the node with the mouse. If WindowsXP Narrator is turned on, it will read the text on the tooltip which is an importat requirement of Section 508 (government requirement for building software that can be used by people with disabilities)

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.ImageUrl
member.summary: Optional image that is displayed before the text of the node.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.ImageExpandedUrl
member.summary: Optional. Should be used only when is specified. The image displayed when the node is expanded.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.ID
member.summary: This property is being used internally by the RadTreeView control. Setting it may lead to unpredictable results.
member.remarks: The ID property is used internally. Use the Value property to store any item related data.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Level
member.summary: Manages the item level of a particular Item instance. This property allows easy implementation/separation of the menu items in levels.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.NavigateUrl
member.summary: The URL the user is redirected to when he/she clicks on the node. Remember to add "http://" in front of links that lead outside your website.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Target
member.summary: Specifies the name of the target frame for Href redirection. Supports "blank" for opening the specified Href in a new window.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Expanded
member.summary: Sets the expanded/collapsed state of a tree-node that contains child nodes.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Checked
member.summary: If checkbox mode is turned on, this property shows whether the node is checked or not.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Checkable
member.summary: If the parent RadTreeView has its CheckBoxes property set to true, RadTreeView automatically displays a checkbox next to each node. You can set this property to false for nodes that do not need to display a checkbox.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Selected
member.summary: If the current node is selected. By default, only one node can be selected, however you can enable multiple node selection by setting the MultipleSelect attribute of the parent RadTreeView to true.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.DragEnabled
member.summary: Enables / disabled the ability to drag this node.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.DropEnabled
member.summary: Enables / disabled the ability to drop nodes over this node.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.EditEnabled
member.summary: Enables / disabled the ability to edit a node.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.ContextMenuName
member.summary: The context menu name that will be opened when end-users right-click the node.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.ExpandMode
member.summary: When set the ExpandMode.ServerSide will fire a server event (NodeExpand) so you can populate the node on demand.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.LongDesc
member.summary: A Section 508 element - applied

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Prev
member.summary: Gets the previous node sibling in the tree structure or returns null if this is the first node in the respective node group.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.Next
member.summary: Gets the next node sibling in the tree structure or returns null if this is the last node in the respective node group.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode.FullPath
member.summary: Returns the full path (location) of the node delimited with slashes. For example if the current node has a Text attribute "Houston", its parent node has a Text attribute "Texas" and its parent (root) node has a Text attribute "U.S.A", FullPath will return "U.S.A/Texas/Houston"

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeCollection
member.summary: A collection of RadTreeNode objects in a RadTreeView control.

remarks.para: The RadTreeNodeCollection class represents a collection of RadTreeNode objects. The RadTreeNode objects in turn represent menu items within a RadTreeView control.

list.item: Use the indexer to programmatically retrieve a single RadTreeNode from the collection, using array notation.
Use the Count property to determine the total number of menu items in the collection.
Use the Add method to add menu items in the collection.
Use the Remove method to remove menu items from the collection.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeCollection.#ctor(Telerik.WebControls.IRadTreeNodeContainer)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RadTreeNodeCollection class.
member.remarks: Use the constructor to create a new RadTreeNodeCollection class.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeCollection.Add(Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode)
member.summary: Appends a RadTreeNode to the end of the collection.

example.para: The following example demonstrates how to programmatically add items in a RadTreeView control.
example.code:
RadTreeNode newsItem = new RadTreeNode("News");
RadTreeView1.Nodes.Add(newsItem);

Dim newsItem As RadTreeNode = New RadTreeNode("News")
RadTreeView1.Nodes.Add(newsItem)

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeCollection.AddRange(Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode[])
member.summary: Adds the items in an array of RadTreeNode objects to the collection.

remarks.para: Use the AddRange method to add the items in the array of RadTreeNode objects specified by the items parameter. This allows you to add multiple RadTreeNode objects to the collection in a single step.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeCollection.Insert(System.Int32,Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode)
member.summary: Inserts the specified RadTreeNode in the collection at the specified index location.
member.remarks: Use the Insert method to add a RadTreeNode to the collection at the index specified by the index parameter.
member.param: The location in the collection to insert the RadTreeNode.
The RadTreeNode to add to the collection.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeCollection.IndexOf(Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode)
member.summary: Determines the index value that represents the position of the specified RadTreeNode in the collection.
member.returns: The zero-based index position of the specified RadTreeNode in the collection.
member.remarks: Use the IndexOf method to determine the index value of the RadTreeNode specified by the item parameter in the collection. If an item with this criteria is not found in the collection, -1 is returned.
member.param: A RadTreeNode to search for in the collection.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeCollection.Contains(Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode)
member.summary: Determines whether the collection contains the specified RadTreeNode.
member.returns: true if the collection contains the specified item; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Use the Contains method to determine whether the RadTreeNode specified by the item parameter is in the collection.
member.param: A RadTreeNode to search for in the collection.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeCollection.Remove(Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNode)
member.summary: Removes the specified RadTreeNode from the collection.
member.remarks: Use the Remove method to remove a RadTreeNode from the collection.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeCollection.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the RadTreeNode at the specified index from the collection.

remarks.para: Use the RemoveAt method to remove the RadTreeNode at the specified index from the collection.

member.param: The index of the RadTreeNode to remove.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeCollection.Clear
member.summary: Removes all items from the collection.
member.remarks: Use the Clear method to remove all items from the collection. The Count property is set to 0.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeCollection.FindNodeByText(System.String)
member.summary: Searches the RadTreeNodeCollection for the first RadTreeNode with a Text property equal to the specified value.
member.returns: A RadTreeNode whose Text property is equal to the specified value.
member.remarks: The method returns the first item matching the search criteria. If no item is matching then null (Nothing in VB.NET) is returned.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeCollection.FindNodeByValue(System.String)
member.summary: Searches the RadTreeNodeCollection for the first RadTreeNode with a Value property equal to the specified value.
member.returns: A RadTreeNode whose Value property is equal to the specified value.
member.remarks: The method returns the first item matching the search criteria. If no item is matching then null (Nothing in VB.NET) is returned.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeCollection.FindNodeByUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Searches the RadTreeNodeCollection for the first Item with a NavigateUrl property equal to the specified value.
member.returns: A Item whose NavigateUrl property is equal to the specified value.
member.remarks: The method returns the first Item matching the search criteria. If no Item is matching then null (Nothing in VB.NET) is returned.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeCollection.Item(System.Int32)

summary.para: Gets a RadTreeNode at the specified index in the collection.

remarks.para: Use this indexer to get a RadTreeNode from the collection at the specified index, using array notation.

member.param: The zero-based index of the RadTreeNode to retrieve from the collection.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeEventArgs.NodeClicked
member.summary: Used to retrieve the node that was clicked in the browser and generated the postback. Typically used in user event handlers that handle the NodeClick event.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeEventArgs.SourceDragNode
member.summary: Used to retrieve the source node of the NodeDrop event.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeEventArgs.DestDragNode
member.summary: Used to retrieve the destination node of the NodeDrop event.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeEventArgs.DropPosition
member.summary: The drop position of the source node regarding the destination node - over (default), above, below.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeEventArgs.NodeBound
member.summary: Used to retrieve the last node that has been bound.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeEventArgs.NodeCreated
member.summary: Used to retrieve the currently created item;

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeEventArgs.NodeEdited
member.summary: Used to retrieve the the node that has been edited;

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeEventArgs.NodeChecked
member.summary: Used to retrieve the the node that has been checked.

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeEventArgs.NewText
member.summary: Used to retrieve the the new text of the edited node;

member.summary: The ID of the context menu item that was clicked

member.name: F:Telerik.WebControls.RadTreeNodeEventArgs.HtmlElementID
member.summary: The ID of the Html element the node was dropped over.
